title: (x) "Royal Tennenbaums" late 60-70s bold 'fun/kooky/family-friendly' serif face - Milano Roman {Mike Y}
content:
If you also know where I could obtain it or something similar that would be super helpful!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [2636266759\_194deb4055.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20090527115802/http:/typophile.com/files/2636266759_194deb4055.jpg) | 81.42 KB |
author: katarina stevens

comments.content: It’s similar to Didoni or Carousel.

I am pretty sure that’s Milano Roman, an old ITC type that Image Club digitized in their old Letterpress CD’s. I do not know of other digital versions.

I have this font from Letterpress 6.0 and could set some type for you if you need a few words. (Sample is from the Serif Font ID Guide, made with the Image Club font)

- Mike Yanega

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090527115802im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/milano_roman_full_3852.gif)
I agree with Mike. See bigger specimen [\*here\*](http://web.archive.org/web/20090527115802/http:/e-daylight.jp/design/fonts/type/m/milano-roman.html).
